text:
When we use oAuth2 to connect to HubSpot Free accounts, everything works fine, but we have an internal error when we try to get a token after the "oauth/authorize" with a HubSpot Marketing Hub Professional account.
What is the best way to have support for this?
Hey <@UB1TT8UAE> Happy to help here or you can post to here <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/bd-p/integrations> whatever you are more comfortable with
I posted: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Problem-to-get-a-token-with-a-HubSpot-Marketing-Professional/m-p/254263>
Ah I see, you should remove your client_secret from the screenshot FYI

Hi there!  I’m looking into creating custom events via API from an external integration, and may be looking to dynamically create new analytics events where they don’t already exist: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/enterprise_events/http_api>

*Anyone know if it’s possible to associate “Tags” to Analytics Events created via API?* (or to associate tags to API-created events after the fact in the UI?)  Presently it only seems possible to add a tag to an event when creating it within the HubSpot UI.
Hey <@UDQ77R8AC> It’s not possible via the API, but you can edit tags in the UI after the fact.  Screenshots to follow
starting here
Hover over the row you want
hit edit from the actions menu
then you can modify the tags for that event
hmm, thanks I was looking in the Active Events tab, which was the wrong place.  Thanks!
NP

<@UFBNA9K9A> I’m using an API call that IDs the events by Name not ID — this is to support dynamic creation of new events.  However, I notice the API call did not match to existing events I’d created ahead of time in the UI:
Any ideas as to why?  (Note that subsequent API calls continued to increment the API-created duplicates, not creating even more duplicates)
Could this be due to punctuation marks not matching exactly based on how they were escaped?
It’s possible, it would definitely have to be an exact (`===`) match here
We should be able to quickly test it if you create a simple event name like `a` or something
then call it form your app
I can test in 30 minutes if you can’t get to it before then
Just tested and it does _not_ find the UI created event by name
hmm even with just “a” as the name?
Thanks for testing.
How do we request all ‘line items’ for ‘deal’ in Ecom bridge? Can’t see anything in documentation for this
<@UFC6BLEAV> there is no documentation for now, but you can check the email code for the same
